paragraph.heading: 1Using debug clauses
paragraph.paragraph: Eiffel provides ways to add debug code to features to help during their debugging. You may think of it as the well-known C construct:
The corresponding construct in Eiffel is provided by the debug keyword. It is possible to wrap code inside a debug clause like this:

paragraph.code_block: debug("MY_DEBUG_FLAG") -- Debug code is here. end

paragraph.paragraph: It is then possible to enable or disable debug clauses globally.
To modify the debug clauses status:

list.item: In the Debug/Profile tab, the enable debug checkbox affects the system globally.
The list under it gives the possibility to enable or disable each debug clause separately, through a context menu that appears when right-clicking on them.

You must
../40_compiling/10_generating_executables.xml recompile your project for the changes to take effect.

paragraph.tip: Tip: Debug clauses make it easy to remove all debug messages when finalizing a system.
